alert.note: Alert for Dodge; Fillmore; Mower; Olmsted (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 23 at 4:01PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact eastern Mitchell, western Howard, southwestern Olmsted, eastern Mower, southern Dodge and western Fillmore Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 400 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Hayfield to near Adams to near Floyd. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Hayfield, Grand Meadow, and Riceville around 405 PM CDT. Le Roy around 410 PM CDT. Kasson around 415 PM CDT. Stewartville, Byron, and Spring Valley around 420 PM CDT. Rochester around 425 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Meyer, County Roads 3 And 108, Brownville, County Roads T 54 And A 31, County Roads 6 And 15, Salem Corners, Rock Dell, Highways 9 And 218, County Roads 4 And 8, and Highway 56 And County 6. This includes Interstate 90 in Minnesota between mile markers 188 and 212. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for north central and northeastern Iowa.
